intro: Hieracium acropsolodes, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellowish to reddish flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and disturbed soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hieracium acropsolodes is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in a variety of soil types.
